definition: to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.english: As dusk descends on the mountains, a pangolin emerges from its burrow.
sentences.chinese: 当薄暮涌入山区，一只穿山甲从地洞钻了出来。

sentences.english: The pangolin whole body's lamella is its thorn, is similar with the nail.
sentences.chinese: 穿山甲浑身的鳞片就是它的刺，与指甲相类似。

sentences.english: ObjectiveTo recognize the method of adulterating and preparation process of Pangolin adulterated with sulphate magnesium.
sentences.chinese: 目的熟悉掺硫酸镁穿山甲的掺假方法与制备过程。

sentences.english: Sad pangolin why always find wear mountain b.
sentences.chinese: 悲伤的穿山甲为什么总是觅不到脱山乙。

sentences.english: Objective To research whether pangolin adulterated with magnesium sulfate can goods after lavation.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究搀硫酸镁穿山甲洗涤后是否能作穿山甲入药。

sentences.english: Objective To research whether pangolin adulterated with magnesium sulfate can goods after lavation.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究搀硫酸镁穿山甲洗涤后是否能作穿山甲入药。

sentences.english: The morphology and composition of the pangolin's scale were analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 对穿山甲鳞片的形态和组成进行了分析。

sentences.english: A variety of Pangolins can be found in Africa and Southern Asia.
sentences.chinese: 非洲和亚洲南部能见到各类穿山甲。

sentences.english: Chinese media reported more than three tons of pangolin scales were seized at a Shanghai port.
sentences.chinese: 中国媒体报道，超过三吨穿山甲鳞片在上海口岸查获。

sentences.english: Pangolins, or Manis Javanica, are endangered species native to south-east Asia.
sentences.chinese: 穿山甲是原产于东南亚的濒危物种。

sentences.english: The Pangolin uses its scales as protection when it roles into a ball to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 当缩成球状睡觉时，穿山甲将其鳞皮作为防身之物。

sentences.english: Pangolins are popular fare at restaurants in China.
sentences.chinese: 穿山甲在中国是极受欢迎的珍馐。

sentences.english: Pangolins have small heads and long, broad tails.
sentences.chinese: 穿山甲长着很小的头和宽大的尾巴。

definition: lizard/common spoken equivalent of 蜥蜴[xi1 yi4]
